intro: Vitex trifolia f. albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflower vitex, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and showy white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they are divided into three leaflets, and the flowers are clustered in panicle inflorescences. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
